To the chief Musician<S>5329</S> on Neginoth<S>5058</S> upon Sheminith<S>8067</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> of David<S>1732</S>. O LORD<S>3068</S>, rebuke<S>3198</S> me not in thine anger<S>639</S>, neither chasten<S>3256</S> me in thy hot displeasure<S>2534</S>. <sup>Sheminith: or, upon the eight</sup>
Have mercy<S>2603</S> upon me, O LORD<S>3068</S>; for I am weak<S>536</S>: O LORD<S>3068</S>, heal<S>7495</S> me; for my bones<S>6106</S> are vexed<S>926</S>.
My soul<S>5315</S> is also sore<S>3966</S> vexed<S>926</S>: but thou, O LORD<S>3068</S>, how long?
Return<S>7725</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, deliver<S>2502</S> my soul<S>5315</S>: oh save<S>3467</S> me for thy mercies'<S>2617</S> sake.
For in death<S>4194</S> there is no remembrance<S>2143</S> of thee: in the grave<S>7585</S> who shall give thee thanks<S>3034</S>?
I am weary<S>3021</S> with my groaning<S>585</S>; all the night<S>3915</S> make I my bed<S>4296</S> to swim<S>7811</S>; I water<S>4529</S> my couch<S>6210</S> with my tears<S>1832</S>. <sup>all: or, every night</sup>
Mine eye<S>5869</S> is consumed<S>6244</S> because of grief<S>3708</S>; it waxeth old<S>6275</S> because of all mine enemies<S>6887</S>.
Depart<S>5493</S> from me, all ye workers<S>6466</S> of iniquity<S>205</S>; for the LORD<S>3068</S> hath heard<S>8085</S> the voice<S>6963</S> of my weeping<S>1065</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> hath heard<S>8085</S> my supplication<S>8467</S>; the LORD<S>3068</S> will receive<S>3947</S> my prayer<S>8605</S>.
Let all mine enemies<S>341</S> be ashamed<S>954</S> and sore<S>3966</S> vexed<S>926</S>: let them return<S>7725</S> and be ashamed<S>954</S> suddenly<S>7281</S>.
